meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pugnacious.
meanings.sent1: His pugnaciousnesses often led to arguments with his classmates.
meanings.sent2: Her pugnaciousnesses sometimes made it difficult to work together peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The pugnaciousnesses of the kitten made everyone laugh as it tried to pick a fight with a stuffed animal.
meanings.sent4: The pugnaciousnesses of the storm clouds warned of an impending thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's pugnaciousnesses in the ring were unmatched, earning him the championship title.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be aggressive or combative.
meanings.sent1: The coach admired the team's pugnaciousnesses on the field.
meanings.sent2: His pugnaciousnesses often got him into trouble with other kids.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the puppy's pugnaciousnesses made him fearless around bigger dogs.
meanings.sent4: The pugnaciousnesses of the waves crashing against the shore showed the power of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The politician's pugnaciousnesses in debates made him a formidable opponent.
